news.title: HC raps MHADA officials for stalling redevelopment of two Pune housing societies
news.para: The Bombay High Court has rebuked MHADA officials for overstepping their authority and jurisdiction by misinterpreting the Chief Minister's remark as a stay on housing redevelopment projects. The court also criticized the local MLA's "extra-legal interference" to pressure officials, upholding the validity of a previously granted NOC and directing a decision on another proposal.

news.title: Six illegal colonies demolished in Ambala Cantonment
news.para: Ambala's District Town Planner demolished six illegal colonies spanning 21.5 acres in Ambala Cantonment. The operation dismantled temporary roads and demolished 27 under-construction structures to curb unauthorized development. Officials urged the public to avoid purchasing property in illegal colonies to prevent financial and legal issues.

news.title: Get fire NOC within 30 days or face action: Ludhiana residents told
news.para: Following a recent major fire, Ludhiana civic body mandates fire safety NOCs for all commercial buildings, educational institutions, and industrial units within 30 days. Non-compliance will result in hefty fines up to Rs 50,000 and potential building sealing. Residents can apply online for assistance.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh plans to offer up to 25% discount to clear 10,000 unsold flats in Ghaziabad
news.para: The Uttar Pradesh government is offering discounts of up to 25% to clear a backlog of nearly 10,000 unsold flats in Ghaziabad. New guidelines aim to standardize pricing and reduce costs, with additional rebates for prompt payments. Premium charges for desirable units have also been capped.

news.title: Fixed fee for property tax name transfers from January in Tambaram
news.para: Tambaram City Municipal Corporation has significantly reduced property tax name change charges, introducing a uniform fee of ₹500 for residential and ₹1,000 for commercial properties. This move, effective from January, replaces the previous system where charges were based on property market value, often costing residents thousands.

news.title: Mysuru: MDA invites landowners to submit consent letters for proposed mega residential layout
news.para: Mysuru Development Authority is planning a large residential layout on 2,113 acres. Landowners will receive 50% of developed land. Villagers claim they are unaware of the project. Real estate experts question its feasibility, suggesting vertical development instead. The project requires consent from over 1,500 landowners.

news.title: NHB flags PMAY 2.0 disbursal lag, urges housing finance companies to step up
news.para: During a review meeting with chief executives of leading housing finance companies (HFCs) last week, the NHB chief said disbursements were "not up to the mark" and urged lenders to sharpen their focus on the programme, officials familiar with the discussions said.

news.title: ED seeks ‘C’ summary report from Sambhajinagar city police in PMAY housing tender case
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has requested the closure report and investigation papers from Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar city police. This pertains to a 2023 Prime Minister Awas Yojana housing tender case. The police had previously closed the case after accepting a 'C' summary report. The ED is now examining the grounds for this closure in relation to its ongoing money laundering probe.

news.title: Alkem Laboratories' founder's parents buy penthouse for ₹63 crore in Bandra, Mumbai
news.para: Satish Kumar Singh and Premlata Singh, parents of Alkem Laboratories founder Sandeep Singh, have purchased a Rs 63 crore penthouse in Khar-Bandra. This 'villa in the sky' at S Raheja’s Evergreen tower boasts exclusive terraces and a double-height living room. The deal sets a new benchmark as the costliest non-sea-facing apartment in Bandra.

news.title: About 300 houses for Wayanad landslide victims to be handed over in Feb: Kerala CM
news.para: In February, Kerala will unveil the first phase of its rehabilitation plan: 300 homes for the victims of the Wayanad landslide. This initiative is part of a larger township development, designed to provide essential facilities that promote a dignified lifestyle.

news.title: Delhi mayor urges people to clear property tax dues under amnesty scheme
news.para: Sardar Raja Iqbal Singh, the Mayor of Delhi, is calling on property owners to clear overdue taxes, introducing the Property Tax Amnesty Scheme 2025-26. This initiative offers a remarkable chance for taxpayers to rid themselves of interest and penalties on dues dating back to before 2020-21.

news.title: Maharashtra: Housing society registration to go online this year, with fewer documents
news.para: Maharashtra's cooperation department is launching an online system for housing society registration, reducing mandatory documents from 29 to 19. This move aims to simplify the process, cut down office visits, and curb middlemen's intervention. The new system, hosted on the 'aaple sarkar' portal, is expected to significantly increase registrations and empower residents.

news.title: Guntur civic body waives off ‘uncollectable’ property tax arrears
news.para: Guntur Municipal Corporation has cleared ₹33.62 crore in old property tax dues. This move aims to clean up records and boost revenue collection. The corporation identified these arrears due to errors and outdated information. Officials conducted thorough checks to ensure fairness. This exercise will help focus on genuine taxes and improve overall recovery rates.

news.title: Certified land records to be issued only online from today: Bihar deputy CM
news.para: Starting January 1, 2026, Bihar will transition to a fully digital land revenue record system, giving legal validity to online documents. In a progressive move, urban residents can now obtain genealogy certificates. The state is also launching 'Operation Bhumi Dakhal Dehani,' targeting 100% land rights for SC/ST communities, with set deadlines for resolving land cases.

news.title: Lucknow development body launches 'FastPass' for building plan approvals
news.para: Lucknow residents can now get building plans approved in minutes with the LDA's new FastPass system. This digital, self-certification process eliminates physical inspections for eligible residential plots up to 100sqm and commercial constructions up to 30sqm.  The initiative aims to speed up approvals, boost transparency, and reduce applicant hassles significantly.

news.title: Karnataka relaxes occupancy certificate rule for houses on 30x40 plots in rural areas
news.para: Farmhouse and new property owners in rural Karnataka now have a significant reprieve. The government has exempted certain residential buildings, specifically those on 30x40 sqft plots and up to G+2 or Stilt+3 floors under gram panchayat limits, from obtaining occupancy certificates. This move aims to reduce administrative burden and expedite essential service connections.

news.title: Beed tops Maharashtra in rural housing drive as more than 50,000 families move into new homes
news.para: Beed district has achieved the top spot in Maharashtra for its rural housing scheme implementation, with over 50,000 families moving into new homes.  The district's success is attributed to meticulous planning, daily monitoring, and overcoming challenges like water scarcity and material constraints, ensuring timely completion of thousands of houses.

news.title: Maharashtra CM urged to withdraw MOFA changes, restore buyers’ rights
news.para: Consumer body Akhil Bharatiya Grahak Panchayat has urged Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis to withdraw recent amendments to the MOFA Act, calling them unjust and anti-consumer. The changes effectively grant legal immunity to builders by removing criminal liability for violations, undermining the Act's purpose of protecting flat purchasers.

news.title: Registrations in Telangana down by 50,000, but revenue up ₹500 crore
news.para: Despite government efforts, Hyderabad's real estate sector faces a significant slump, with property registrations dropping by 50,000 documents this fiscal year. While revenue has seen a slight increase, it remains far below the Rs 19,100 crore target. Officials attribute the dip to factors like increased reliance on home loans, which necessitate higher declared property values, and fluctuating market conditions.

news.title: Creditors realised ₹4 lakh crore under IBC till September 2025: RBI report
news.para: By September 30, 2025, the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code has enabled creditors to reclaim Rs 4 lakh crore through various resolution plans. The initiation of more than 8,600 corporate insolvency cases, most of which have reached closure, demonstrates the code's impact on saving countless struggling enterprises.
